isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Fuel and High-pressure Oil Systems - Installation - High-pressure Oil Hose and Elbows

step1.para: Rotate both elbow jam nuts all the way to the base of the elbows.
Install new O-rings and back-up ring on the 70 and 90 degree elbows.
Lubricate new O-rings with clean engine oil.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, make all adjustments to the high-pressure oil elbows within 15 minutes of applying Loctite®.

step1.para:
Apply two beads of Loctite® 246 Threadlocker
to the threads of both high-pressure oil elbows.

figure.caption: High-pressure oil hose and elbows (flexible conduit cover removed)

step1.para: Install 70 degree elbow into high-pressure oil port on intake side of the cylinder head. Run fitting all the way in finger tight and then back fitting off (less than one full turn) to orient fitting toward the front of the engine.
Install 90 degree elbow into high-pressure oil pump. Run fitting all the way in finger tight and then back fitting off (less than one full turn) to orient fitting.
Remove the flexible conduit cover from the high-pressure oil hose.
Install the high-pressure oil hose on the 70 and 90 degree elbows and finger tighten swivel nuts.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, orient the high-pressure oil hose so the hose is not under any excess tension, the hose bends in a smooth arc, is not twisted, and does not touch other engine components.

step1.para:
Orient the high-pressure oil hose so the hose is not under any excess tension and is not twisted. Use one wrench to hold the high-pressure hose nut in place while tightening its corresponding swivel nut to special torque
using another wrench.

Orient the high-pressure oil hose so the hose is not under any excess tension and the hose bends in a smooth arc. Use one wrench to hold each elbow in place while tightening its elbow jam nut to special torque
using another wrench.
Install the flexible conduit cover on the high-pressure oil hose.
